result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D. Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas D. Carlson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas D. Carlson was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Nicholas D. Carlson was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
Def to start jail time on April 14, 2017, serve 1st 48 hours without work release, may be furloughed until May 3, 2017 at 10 am for Pierce County home monitoring, if he so chooses. Release date July 19, 2017. May serve in St Croix County if at no additional cost to Pierce County.
Concurrent with: Ct#3

from Atty Nero  to amend JOC to amend furlough date to May 3, 2017
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

8:43 a.m.  Defendant Nicholas D. Carlson in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 16CM184.  Froelich - 16CM149 State would move to dismiss Ct 1, Ct 2 - guilty plea, 2 yr probation, 90 days conditional jail time, no contact with Ryan Sherril and Morgan Higgens, 30 days to determine restitution. Ct 3, guilty, 2 yrs probation concurrent, jail time concurrent to Ct 2, 30 days to determine restitution and same no contact provisions.  16CM184  would be dismissed.   Nero - discrepancy.  Reviews with Defendant.  8:48 off record.  8:52 back on record.  Nero in agreement with State except conditional jail time.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2 and Ct 3 in 16CM149.    Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 and Ct 3 in 16CM149.  Court dismisses Ct. 1 in 16CM149 and dismisses 16CM184.  
Court orders S/W, 2 years probation, conditions as set by agent,  90 days conditional jail time with work release, First 48 hours to be served with no work release.  concurrent with Count 1.  If served in Pierce Co would be furloughed after first 48 hours until next home monitoring date.  May be served in St. Croix Co. if it can be done with no additional costs to Pierce County.   No contact with Ryan Sherril or Morgan Higgens, 30 days to determine restitution, Court costs  $443.00  - Count 2;  Count 3 court orders S/W, 2 years probation concurrent to Count 2,  90 days conditional jail time, no contact with Ryan Sherril or Morgan Higgens, 30 days to determine restitution, court costs $443.00.  Defendant to report by 7:00 p.m tonight, serve first 48 hours with no work release, may be furloughed until April 19, 2017 at 10:00 a.m. for Pierce County home monitoring if he choose.   Release date - July 5, 2017.  Likely to serve entire sentence in St. Croix County.  Appeal rights are given.  9:45 a.m.
Plea hearing on April 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.

11:07  Includes 16CM184 Defendant Nicholas D. Carlson in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - case is still unresolved.  Nero states the case will be resolved and wants it set for a plea.  Take off trial calendat and put on to the courts calendar before April 14th for a plea. Attorneys will get the plea set.
